snippet: A Libyan militia has detained four officials of the International Criminal Court since last Thursday on spurious charges. They should be released immediately.
abstract: Editorial calls for the release of four International Criminal Court officials who are being detained by a Libyan militia after traveling to the country to help Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi prepare for his war crimes trial; argues that the incident raises serious doubts about the Libyan government's fairness and its ability to hold a secure trial for Qaddafi.
lead_paragraph: A Libyan militia has detained four officials of the International Criminal Court since last Thursday on spurious charges. They should be released immediately.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
